item.title: 邦迪海滩议员称气候行动不能等待经济好转
item.description: 澳大利亚独立议员阿莱格拉-斯彭德（Allegra Spender）坚持认为，气候行动不能被国家的经济困难所耽搁，并提出了她在下届大选后组成少数党政府时可能会提出的要求。【原文：Australian independent lawmaker Allegra Spender has insisted that climate action can’t be delayed by the nation’s economic difficulties, setting up her potential demands in the event of a minority government following the next election.】

item.title: 特朗普下令联邦政府控制加州水资源
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统主张联邦政府对加利福尼亚州的水资源管理决策拥有更多控制权，并命令美国官员凌驾于地方当局之上，认为这些措施是提高该州灭火能力所必需的。【原文：President Donald Trump is asserting more federal government control over water management decisions in California and ordering US officials to override local authorities, casting the steps as necessary to boost the state’s firefighting capabilities.】

item.title: 波士顿和新英格兰地区近海发生小地震
item.description: 周一上午，缅因州海岸附近发生了一次小地震，震中位于新英格兰北部，包括波士顿地区的一些地方。【原文：Northern New England, including some parts of the Boston area, was shaken by a small earthquake that rumbled just off the coast of Maine on Monday morning.】

item.title: 研究显示：气候变化将导致欧洲死亡人数增加
item.description:
最新研究表明，未来几年死于过热的人数将超过死于极寒天气的人数降幅。【原文：

New research shows more people will die from overheating in the coming years than the fall in deaths from extremely cold weather.

】

item.title: 加州暴风雨引发泥石流风险，州际公路关闭
item.description: 随着阵雨继续浸润洛杉矶周围被烧焦的土地，南加州将再多几个紧张的小时。【原文：Southern California will clock a few more tense hours as showers continue to soak the burn-scarred landscape around Los Angeles.】

item.title: 联邦紧急事务管理局的未来
item.description: 今天的时事通讯将探讨联邦紧急事务管理局（FEMA）面临的威胁。唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统已经召集了一个委员会来审查该机构的效用，有可能在洛杉矶最需要它的时候取消或彻底改革它。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享完整报道。如需了解更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the what’s at stake with FEMA under threat. President Donald Trump has convened a council to examine the usefulness of the agency, potentially eliminating or overhauling it just when Los Angeles needs it most. You can read and share the full story on Bloomberg.com. For more climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.description:
位于水牛城东部基尼西县的 500 兆瓦 Cider 项目预计将于 2026 年竣工。【原文：

item.title: 德国担心电池热潮将加剧电网拥堵
item.description: 德国将大型电池的推广作为清洁能源网络顺利运行的关键。然而，政府官员和输电运营商担心，如果管理不当，在错误的地点建造这些电池将会堵塞电网。【原文：Germany has touted the rollout of large batteries as key to the smooth running of a clean-energy grid. Yet there’s fear among government officials and transmission operators that building these in the wrong location will clog up the network if not properly managed.】

item.title: 花旗分析师称特朗普政策无法逆转能源转型
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：The policies of President Donald Trump will fail to hold back progress in transitioning away from high-carbon energy sources, according to analysts at Citigroup Inc.】

item.title: 暴风雨触发西欧红色天气警报
item.description: 风暴 "赫米妮亚 "引发了葡萄牙北部和西班牙沿岸巨浪的红色警报，而法国的伊勒维兰省（Ile-et-Vilaine）则在为洪水做准备。【原文：Storm Herminia triggered red alerts for huge waves along the coast of northern Portugal and Spain, while the French department of Ile-et-Vilaine braced for flooding.】

item.title: 中国可再生能源学会称，2024 年中国能源高速增长导致排放量上升
item.description: 根据能源与清洁空气研究中心（Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air）的数据，去年中国的碳排放量略有增长，原因是新安装的清洁电力设备跟不上能源需求的激增。【原文：China’s carbon emissions grew slightly last year as new clean power installations couldn’t keep pace with a surge in energy demand, according to the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air.】

item.title: 特朗普在争夺更多化石燃料的战斗中夺取战时权力
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布进入能源紧急状态，这为他行使冷战时期的广泛权力和鲜为人知的权威打开了大门，以便快速铺设输油管道、扩大电网和挽救陷入困境的煤电厂。【原文：President Donald Trump’s declaration of an energy emergency opens the door to wield sweeping Cold War-era powers and little-known authorities to fast track pipelines, expand power grids and save struggling coal plants.】

item.title: 洛杉矶 "雨水充沛"，但仍面临山体滑坡风险
item.description: 南加州终于迎来了一些急需的降雨，这将为仍在与多处大火搏斗的消防员提供帮助，不过潮湿的天气也带来了山体滑坡的风险。【原文：Southern California is finally getting some much-needed rain that will assist firefighters still battling several blazes, though wet weather also brings the risk of landslides.】

item.title: 狂风暴雨袭击英国和法国，爱尔兰数千人断电
item.description: 伦敦（美联社）— 在这场多年来破坏性最大的暴风雨过后，爱尔兰向英国和法国求援，抢修人员努力恢复数十万人的供电。就在清理工作继续进行的同时，英国、爱尔兰和法国在周日遭遇了更多潮湿多风的天气。【原文：LONDON (AP) — Ireland called in help from England and France as repair crews worked to restore power to hundreds of thousands of people after the most disruptive storm for years. Even as the cleanup continued, more wet and windy weather hit the U.K., Ireland and France on Sunday.】

item.title: 英格兰西南部记录到 80 英里/小时阵风，发布天气警告
item.description: 在 "艾云 "风暴之后，英格兰西南部又发布了风雨警报，并录得 80 英里/小时的阵风。【原文：Gusts of 80mph have been recorded in south-west England amid further wind and rain warnings in the wake of Storm Eowyn.】

item.title: 尽管内阁意见分歧，里夫斯仍为希斯罗机场新建跑道辩护
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）提出了扩建希思罗机场的理由，最强烈地暗示她准备为在伦敦最繁忙的机场修建有争议的第三条跑道开绿灯，这一决定引起了政府的分歧。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves made the case for expanding Heathrow in the strongest hint yet that she’s preparing to green-light a controversial third runway at London’s busiest airport in a decision that’s divided the government.】

item.title: 雪佛龙称安哥拉油田运营正常
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp. ）称，在安哥拉海岸出现油膜和碎片后，该公司的卡宾达海湾石油公司（Cabinda Gulf Oil Co.【原文：Chevron Corp. said its Cabinda Gulf Oil Co. operations are running normally after an oil sheen and debris were reported along the coast of Angola.】

item.title: 暴风雨过后，北爱尔兰仍有十多万人停电
item.description: 风暴 "艾云 "过后，北爱尔兰仍有 10 多万人停电。【原文：More than 100,000 remain without power in Northern Ireland in the aftermath of Storm Eowyn.】

item.title: 降雨帮助了加州消防员，但也带来了有毒灰烬的风险
item.description: 洛杉矶（美联社）— 在经历了数周的大风和干燥天气后，干涸的南加州降下了雨水，预计将为正在清理多处野火的消防员提供帮助。但在烧焦的山坡上可能出现的倾盆大雨会带来新的麻烦，如有毒的火山灰流。【原文：LOS ANGELES (AP) — After weeks of windy and dry weather, rain has fallen in parched Southern California and is expected to aid firefighters who are mopping up multiple wildfires. But potentially heavy downpours on charred hillsides could bring new troubles such as toxic ash runoff.】

item.title: 中国电力需求激增引发气候难题
item.description: 中国的电力需求正成为全球应对气候变化的关键焦点。【原文：China’s electricity demand is becoming a key focal point in the global fight against climate change.】

item.title: 洛杉矶火灾难民与雪鸟争抢棕榈泉租房
item.description: 米尔德里德-布里格诺尼（Mildred Brignoni）试图在洛杉矶的家中坚持下去，即使日落大火舔舐的距离很近，她可以从窗户看到火焰。【原文：Mildred Brignoni tried to stick it out in her Los Angeles home, even as the Sunset Fire licked close enough that she could see the flames from her window.】

item.description: 今天的时事通讯回顾了唐纳德-特朗普总统本周马不停蹄地发布的一系列行政命令，以及这些行政命令对美国气候进步的意义。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享全文。如需了解更多气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks back at President Donald Trump's nonstop stream of executive orders this week and what they mean for US climate progress. 】

item.title: 预报周末有雨，洛杉矶火区附近有山体滑坡风险
item.description: 随着南加州准备迎接入春以来的第一场大雨，洛杉矶正在为近期野火附近可能出现的山体滑坡和危险的径流做好准备。【原文：Los Angeles is bracing for potential landslides and dangerous runoff near recent wildfires, as Southern California prepares for its first significant rains since spring.】

item.title: 特朗普冻结能源部开支和贷款
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份能源部代理部长的备忘录，作为 "全面审查 "的一部分，特朗普政府已经停止了能源部的开支、贷款和其他行动，以确保它们与总统的优先事项保持一致。【原文：The Trump administration has halted spending, loans and other actions at the Energy Department as part of a “comprehensive review” to ensure they align with the president’s priorities, according to a memo from the agency’s acting secretary seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: 新野火在圣地亚哥南部燃烧，预报显示将有降雨
item.description: 由于南加州即将迎来九个多月以来的首次明显降雨，消防员们正在争分夺秒地控制圣迭戈县一场迅速蔓延的灌木丛大火，而整个地区的其他大火仍在继续燃烧。【原文：Firefighters are racing to contain a fast-growing brush fire in San Diego County, while other blazes continue to burn throughout the region as Southern California inches closer to its first significant rainfall in more than nine months.】
